intro: Crataegus handyae, commonly known as the Handy’s hawthorn, is a species of flowering plant in the Rosaceae family. It is native to the southwestern United States, particularly found in Arizona and New Mexico. This shrub or small tree typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. The plant produces white to pink flowers in the spring, followed by red berries that are an important food source for local wildlife. Its botanical features include thorny branches, simple leaves, and a compact growth habit.
